titlestmt.titleproper: National Society of the Colonial Dames of America records 1848-1918
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: National Society of the Colonial Dames of America records
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: (Mrs. James Starr, Jr. was the president of the PA chapter and chair of the National Committee for the Preservation of Existing Records)

scopecontent.p: The collection contains information related to the work and membership of the National Society of the Colonial Dames of America, particularly the Pennsylvania chapter. Three ledgers list the lineages of members of the society, mainly from the Philadelphia area; the ledgers also include some accounting information, mostly from the 1840s and 1850s, which may be unrelated. There are also correspondence, reports and other materials relating to preservation of records of the organization, 1913-1918. Correspondence is primarily with other state chapters of the organization.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
